comments.commentBody: Watch the Rachel Maddow program of Monday 2//27 in which she connects the dots between Putin, a Russian billionaire, the Bank of Cyprus, Trump, and Wilbur Ross and the laundering of Russian billions.  Hear about the sweet "deal" in which a Russian billionaire paid $100 million for an estate in Palm Beach which Trump had purchased a few years earlier for $40 million.  A deal that handed Trump a $60 million windfall at a moment when he was desperate for money and the Russian was moving as many millions/billions as possible out of Russia so his wife wouldn't get it in their messy divorce.   The money was moving through the Bank of Cyprus where Wilbur Ross, the new Secretary of Commerce, sits on the board and the CEO is the disgraced former CEO of Deutsche Bank which was fined millions by the US and Germany for laundering Russian money. After he was dumped by Deutsche Bank, he landed at Bank of Cyprus which is now doing the same thing.   The Russian connections in the Trump administration are many and run deep.  If Maddow could access all of this information -- so can the rest of the media and definitely the US intelligence agencies can and should be putting it all together and ultimately forcing Trump and his entire corrupt, ugly gang out of the government.

replies.commentBody: Check out the Jeff Sessions lying under oath as reported in the Washington Post this evening.  How's that?

comments.commentBody: You could have stopped after the first sentence, where the news ended.  Anonymous sources suggesting unnamed persons could have met with unnamed persons.  Come on!
Good job NYT. Give us more information like this and less about Trump's idiotic speeches.

"Yes, lots of it actually, throughout the election season. Phonecalls, repeated phonecalls, with transcripts."
"With both parties doing shady stuff, right?"
"No, actually, only Trump Campaign officials. And only with Russian Intelligence officers and related oligarchs. High-level people."
"So why isn’t this all over the front page news?"
"Uh, it is. Has been, for weeks. Apparently Trump supporters and Republicans in general don’t find contact between campaign officials and Russian Intelligence agents to be an issue. No problem. Nothing to see here..."
"But that’s espionage, real spycraft, and directly tied to the most sacred of democratic principles, the ballot, the right to cast a vote freely, without coercion. I mean, really? Russian spies?"
"Oh, yes, they’re real Russian spies. Or they were. Russia has put many of them in jail since all this happened last year. The spies, I mean. It makes it tough for any leaks to get out from the Russian side on this. But the U.S. Intelligence records are fairly complete. They have all the calls recorded."
"Seriously??"
"Yes, but don’t get all worked up, apparently most Trump supporters don’t seem to even care that the Russians interfered with an election. They don’t want to make the new President look bad or anything."
"Even Russian spying? Ronald Reagan must be just spinning in his grave."
Thank you President Obama for giving us eight unblemished years of solid leadership.  I wish you could have given us more.
Can we impeach him now?  Please?

It is only fitting that in a democracy on life support with a significant
minority not interested enough to vote in November, with a significant
minority dismissive of any effort to make transparent much that is
murky, ill defined, implausible, and unexplained about the so called president's relationships with Russia, the relevant Congressional committees are slow and hesitant to organize what is needed, with at least one chairman Devin Nunes (with support by his fellow party committee members) completely
dismissive that any of the murkiness has any substance behind it. The rush
to dismiss with mere formal waves of the gavel illustrate
a deep dysfunction at the heart of the institutions of the republic. The support of this institutional and deeply partisan indifference among a significant minority of the population also
reflects this pathology that is eating away at the body politic. It can no
longer recognize what it is that is killing it, nor does it seem
terribly motivated to inquire further.

If this reporting is totally accurate, I fear for what is to come in the future when one administration leaves and a new one comes in. No doubt Trump's associates had contact with Russians but to what extent and what was discussed? Was Trump aware of contacts by his associates? Was he informed in the few briefings he attended after he was elected? Could Obama have used his executive powers to start an investigation if the concern was so great that his aides broke protocol and gave sensitive information to people outside the intelligence community for political purposes?

Yes, investigations should be done by bipartisan but the actions by Obama aides sets a new precedent for future administrations. A line has been crossed and it cannot be undone as Reid did by using the nuclear option when he was advised to not do it. Now, Trump can appoint anyone to the federal bench and he will be assured they will be confirmed by the Senate.

I am more concerned at this point about the lack of responsibility by Obama aides not just leaking information but actively being involved in providing files and other information because of something suspected but not proven beyond a shadow of a doubt.

I am not a Trump supporter but I do support the rule of law and protocol within an administration still in power. This was reckless behavior and it has set a dangerous precedent for the future and our children and grandchildren will eventually pay for it. This is a sign of things to come.

replies.commentBody: Can you imagine if the roles were reversed and the Bush administration had leaked information that Obama was not a US citizen?

comments.commentBody:
Can you imagine if the roles were reversed and President Obama refused to release his tax returns? Republicans would be going crazy holding hearings night and day! Now they yawn.
And if there were evidence that the Russians tilted the election in his favor? Impeachment hearings would have begun ASAP. Now, Republicans thank the Russians for advancing their cause by helping Trump get elected. And don't fool yourself the Russians will be amply rewarded.
Shame on them for putting party before country!!
We need to vote the whole lot out - vote, vote, always show up to vote.
If you love your country and democracy, RESIST!

replies.commentBody: You mean the Watergate where the Deputy Director of the FBI committed sedition by actively seeking the overthrow of the President of the United States by betraying his constitutional oath because he was passed over for promotion to director of the FBI..yes I mean Deep Throat...who is supposed to be some kind of hero but was merely a bitter man willing to guide the emerging Coup de etat. You mean THAT Watergate. Or do you mean the Watergate where John Dean initiated the bugging to find out if the Democrats knew his wife was a high priced call girl...a charge he denied but LOST in court when he filed suit claiming defamation.  That Watergate...or the current Watergate..where elements of the intelligence agencies are actively committing sedition to eek to undermine and delegitimize the Trump Presidency with the most ridiculous McCarthyite campaign of lies and slander and character assassination, including leakig Natinal Security documents, sources and method...of which the New York Times is a principal co- conspirator, I guess you mean THAT Watergate.

comments.commentBody:
Go to YouTube and watch the Watergate hearings.

Notice how the Republicans looking to protect Nixon shared a strategy: attack leaks and the leakers.

Now match that up to the current administration's attack on this story:
attack leaks and the leakers.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=76cAgGlcrrU

It's well past time to call for a bipartisan independent commission to thoroughly investigate Trump and his Russian collusion. We also need to subpoena his taxes pronto. It's so obvious that Trump is at best compromised (impeachspeak: misdemeanors) and at worst a traitor of the highest order (impeachspeak: high crimes). Also, it's obvious that his "election" was utterly illegitimate - he barely won the electoral vote and that only with help from Russia and the FBI aided by GOP voter suppression in FL, WI, and NC (perhaps more). And he overwhelmingly lost the popular vote, by more than any "President" ever! Please, journalists - help Congress save our Republic from this criminal travesty and impeach this monster.

The deconstruction of the Bannonian Post-Modern-Feudalist State has BEGUN!!!!!

And than goodness it was stopped before it got off the ground.

Bravo for former President Obama! You did exactly what was needed. The world thanks you!

And as for the current POTUS, the other shoe is dropping as we speak. I hope you're ready. Ten, nine, eight...

On the upside, more great spy thrillers coming soon to a theater near you.

We need to learn as much as possible about the nature of the contacts between the Trump camp and the Russians. I have no faith in GOP congressional leaders to thoroughly investigate this issue. What possible innocent explanation could there be for a US presidential campaign to have multiple contacts with Putin's people? We can only hope ongoing leaking won't let this story disappear.

I am reminded of a quote from Edward VI when confronted by malfeasance by his uncle Thomas Seymour. "Methinks this speaks to treason." Investigations must amp up immediately-if 45 and his minions have nothing to hide, they should be afraid of nothing.

The biggest meddling in the election came from within our own government, when James Comey said there were new suspicious Clinton emails just days before Nov. 8. It didn't matter that he later cleared the emails; the damage to HRC was done once and for all.

Sure, investigate the Trump team. But James Comey is the one that threw the election!

replies.commentBody: Stay tuned and prepare to eat your words you reality adverse GOP deplorable....

You do realize there's more at stake than that, don't you?
Careful. You sound like sour grapes.
No.  Again you are projecting what Trump would do on Obama.  Did you not also read that they were giving a lot of that money to charity.  Something that Trump says he does but never does.

comments.commentBody:
What is actually meant by this article is that they left a trail of disinformation to discredit the new President and his incoming administration.

Obama was a sell out, as wittnessed by his latest book mega deal.

His ( Obama ) popularity would increase if the incoming President was reviled and his popularity waned. Obama is probably the worst President we ever had, and I still strongly believe that his passive aggressive personality did more harm to American power and it's projestion that any other person alive.
Great story, NYT ! Keep it up, I and millions will support you. Keep holding their feet to the fire !
Just one more reason to miss Obama.

The illegitimate person sitting in the Oval Office and his corrupt team are looking increasing less legitimate and honorable with each passing day as they go to great lengths to make this Russian story disappear at any and all cost to our democracy. It is truly despicable and frightening. One would assume any innocent and decent public servant would not only be open to any and all investigations but insist on one to clear this up rather than playing the victim card and blame game at every turn. I hope the Congressional Democrats and the free press will not give up on this until there are definitive answers.

Nyet my president!

I just want to say how much I admire the work done at the New York Times.
You people are amazing. I hope you know how much you are doing for our democracy. You are our heroes of the day. We know how hard you are working and thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

We know the dossier is true. We know that many of trump's cabinet picks == Tillerson, Ross -- were involved with the Russians and his appoint,ends like Flynn, Gary Cohen -- Goldman Sachs chairman!!! -- and the pinheads like Michael cohen and others "negotiating" over Crimea, Minafort et al. The only reason he's getting away with treason is a Republican majority in congress. Yes hopes would be reversing Congress in 2018 and then getting rid of trump.

A simple burglary back in 1972, not even covered by major news outlets, led to the downfall of an American President because intrepid journalists sensed a cover up. There is much, much more to the Russian involvement in our countries election and the connection to trump and his organization. We have only begun to scratch the surface.

All we have that stands between our democracy and a dictatorship is the forth estate.

replies.commentBody: you are stupid. sorry, but that's the only word that communicates what I mean.
It's called journalism.  The intelligence agencies will read the reports which the NYT does not currently have access to.  Why are you seemingly so nervous if you think this story has no legs?
How would you respond if Trump were a Democrat? Were you outraged at the endless insinuations about Hillary?

comments.commentBody:
What are the facts here? I see none. Is there any verifiable evidence?

Apparently we do not know if the Trump campaign contacted the Russians or visa versa. Nor, if they did, what they talked about. Is it against the law for American citizens to talk to Russians?

This is what was written:

"It also reflected the suspicion among many in the Obama White House" Many??

"American allies, including the British and the Dutch, had provided information" Who?

"possible contacts between associates of President-elect Donald J. Trump and Russians "

"a suspicion that American officials say has not been confirmed."

"Some officials began asking specific questions at intelligence briefings" Some?

"All spoke on the condition of anonymity because they were discussing classified information, nearly all of which remains secret" A criminal act by anonymous sources?

" and some said they were speaking" Some?

" making an independent public assessment of the competing Obama and Trump administration claims impossible." What then is the news here? If you can't verify it why print it?

"The nature of the contacts remains unknown. " Why mention it then?

This appears to be another fake news story by the NYT written to keep the Russian's-Did-It story alive. We should believe what is alleged when we actually see some evidence instead of rank speculation. We should give a darn when someone coherently, using hard evidence, explains the impact of someone talking to some Russians.
It's becoming clearer and clearer why Trump is trying to intimidate the legitimate press.
